item.title: Footnotes - Serverless Computing: One Step Forward, Two Steps Back
item.description:
Footnotes

[1] This might be better termed a “proprietary library”, but the analogy to C’s stdlib is apropos: not officially part of the programming model, but integral in practice. ↩

[2] In many blog posts ostensibly about serverless computing, FaaS is combined with “non-serverless” services: i.e., services that do not autoscale, like AWS Elasticache. Design patterns that use non-serverless services are out of scope of our discussion; one might even argue they are anti-patterns for serverless development since they do not autoscale. ↩

item.title: Footnotes - Trivial Trojans: How Minimal MCP Servers Enable Cross-Tool Exfiltration of Sensitive Data
item.description:
Footnotes

[1] Throughout this paper, we use “AI agents” to refer to large language models operating through MCP-enabled client applications (e.g., Claude via Claude Desktop) that can discover and invoke tools from MCP servers. ↩

[2] https://modelcontextprotocol.io ↩

[2-2] https://github.com/anthropics/mcp ↩

[3] The complete implementation of our proof-of-concept malicious weather server is available at: https://github.com/Nicocro/mcp-trivial-trojans ↩

[3-2] Model Context Protocol Contributors. MCP Quickstart: Building Your First Server. https://modelcontextprotocol.io/quickstart/server, 2024. ↩

[3-3] fastMCP Contributors. fastMCP Documentation. https://github.com/jlowin/fastmcp, 2024. ↩
